androidx.leanback.media

Class MediaPlayerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.leanback.media.PlayerAdapter
      • androidx.leanback.media.MediaPlayerAdapter

  • public class MediaPlayerAdapter
extends PlayerAdapter
    This implementation extends the PlayerAdapter with a MediaPlayer.

    • Method Detail

      • onAttachedToHost

        public void onAttachedToHost(PlaybackGlueHost host)
        Description copied from class: PlayerAdapter
        This method is called attached to associated PlaybackGlueHost.
        Overrides:
        onAttachedToHost in class PlayerAdapter

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Will reset the MediaPlayer and the glue such that a new file can be played. You are not required to call this method before playing the first file. However you have to call it before playing a second one.

      • release

        public void release()
        Release internal MediaPlayer. Should not use the object after call release().

      • onDetachedFromHost

        public void onDetachedFromHost()
        Description copied from class: PlayerAdapter
        This method is called when current associated PlaybackGlueHost is attached to a different PlaybackGlue or PlaybackGlueHost is destroyed. Subclass may override. A typical implementation will release resources (e.g. MediaPlayer or connection to playback service) in this method.
        Overrides:
        onDetachedFromHost in class PlayerAdapter

      • onError

        protected boolean onError(int what,
                          int extra)
        Called to indicate an error.
        Parameters:
        what - the type of error that has occurred:
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_UNKNOWN
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_SERVER_DIED
        extra - an extra code, specific to the error. Typically implementation dependent.
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_IO
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_MALFORMED
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_ERROR_TIMED_OUT
        • MEDIA_ERROR_SYSTEM (-2147483648) - low-level system error.
        Returns:
        True if the method handled the error, false if it didn't. Returning false, will cause the PlayerAdapter.Callback.onPlayCompleted(PlayerAdapter) being called.

      • onSeekComplete

        protected void onSeekComplete()
        Called to indicate the completion of a seek operation.

      • onInfo

        protected boolean onInfo(int what,
                         int extra)
        Called to indicate an info or a warning.
        Parameters:
        what - the type of info or warning.
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_UNKNOWN
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_VIDEO_TRACK_LAGGING
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_VIDEO_RENDERING_START
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_BUFFERING_START
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_BUFFERING_END
        • MEDIA_INFO_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH (703) - bandwidth information is available (as extra kbps)
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_BAD_INTERLEAVING
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_NOT_SEEKABLE
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_METADATA_UPDATE
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_UNSUPPORTED_SUBTITLE
        • MediaPlayer#MEDIA_INFO_SUBTITLE_TIMED_OUT
        extra - an extra code, specific to the info. Typically implementation dependent.
        Returns:
        True if the method handled the info, false if it didn't. Returning false, will cause the info to be discarded.

      • setProgressUpdatingEnabled

        public void setProgressUpdatingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from class: PlayerAdapter
        Implement this method to enable or disable progress updating.
        Overrides:
        setProgressUpdatingEnabled in class PlayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable progress updating, false otherwise.

      • setDataSource

        public boolean setDataSource(Uri uri)
        Sets the media source of the player witha given URI.
        Returns:
        Returns true if uri represents a new media; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        MediaPlayer#setDataSource(String)

      • isPrepared

        public boolean isPrepared()
        Overrides:
        isPrepared in class PlayerAdapter
        Returns:
        True if MediaPlayer OnPreparedListener is invoked and got a SurfaceHolder if PlaybackGlueHost provides SurfaceHolder.

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
